Articles.Content:
I'm sorry if Ask it again, and if there are many other posts on that but that's a very specific topic

'cause...

I'm looking for a mod (or not - developerssss !!! ) to scan in Career Mode

I've tried ISA but actually fail (at least nothing appear in science component), and I'm not a coder so don't ask to me do edit files

any advice about that ?

Edited November 12, 2013 by MaximilianPs

I haven't used the MapSat addon myself, but the tutorial vids I've seen show the parts under the "Utility" tab, not the "Science" tab. Have you looked there?

=Smidge=
Have you unlocked the parts in R&D?

Since you're asking about mods I'll move this to add-on discussions.

However, adding mods into career mode actually isn't too hard. I'm not aware of any mod currently that automatically inserts itself into careermode, you have to manually pick the parts you want and add a few lines to their config file.

If you add the following into your config then the mod parts would be available at start, you'll have to click them in R&D to unlock them but that'll be all that's needed.

TechRequired = start

entryCost = 0

If you want to insert parts into other sections of the tech tree it's a bit more work, I haven't looked into it in detail but I think it'll include looking into your sciencedefs config to see what the different tech sections are called, entering their "techrequired" name and cost.

However, adding mods into career mode actually isn't too hard. I'm not aware of any mod currently that automatically inserts itself into careermode, you have to manually pick the parts you want and add a few lines to their config file.

There are alot of mods already integrated into career mod......how are you a mod and not aware of that?

Also, there is a much better mapping mod than ISA now....

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55832-PLUGIN-PARTS-WIP-SCANsat-terrain-mapping

and I think its already worked into career mode.

Confirmed, ScanMap is at the 4th level of research on the bottom line (where you find the first battery)

thank you
